response.original_title: M & M Smith: For Posterity's Sake
response.overview: Morgan and Marvin Smith, twin brothers, and prolific African American artists, boldly moved from Kentucky to New York in 1933 to pursue artistic careers. By 1937 they had opened a photo studio next door to Harlem's renowned Apollo Theatre. Thus began 50-year-long careers as still and motion picture photographers, painters, and sound recordists.
response.tagline: The social artistry of African American photographers and twin brothers, Morgan & Marvin Smith
response.title: M & M Smith: For Posterity's Sake
